{"step_by_step_thinking": "Betamethasone is a corticosteroid that is commonly administered to pregnant women at risk of preterm delivery to promote lung maturity in the fetus and reduce the risk of neonatal respiratory distress syndrome. This is supported by Document [1], Document [0], and Document [3]. Document [26] also suggests that betamethasone can reduce the incidence of intraventricular hemorrhage in preterm infants. However, there is no evidence in the provided documents to suggest that betamethasone can prevent hyperbilirubinemia in neonates.", "answer_choice": "C"}
